Indeed so. That idiom of pre-increment, in 'for' statements, is part of 
out house style manual, for that very reason.


On 13/01/2011 07:54, Evert Haasdijk wrote:
> Why would this use of pre-increment be problematic? In fact, it is
> faster because pre-increment can just return its updated operand, post-
> increment can't.


-- 
Rob Marsden
Gistix (Northern) Limited
